  13. static ngx_inline void *ngx_palloc_small(ngx_pool_t *pool, size_t size,
  14.     ngx_uint_t align);

  19. ngx_pool_t *
  20. ‌ngx_create_pool(size_t size, ngx_log_t *log)
  21. {
  22.     ngx_pool_t  *p;

  24.     p = ngx_memalign(NGX_POOL_ALIGNMENT, size, log);
  25.     if (p == NULL) {
  26.         return NULL;
  27.     }

  29.     p->d.last = (u_char *) p + sizeof(ngx_pool_t);
  30.     p->d.end = (u_char *) p + size;
  31.     p->d.next = NULL;
  32.     p->d.failed = 0;

  34.     size = size - sizeof(ngx_pool_t);
  35.     p->max = (size < NGX_MAX_ALLOC_FROM_POOL) ? size : NGX_MAX_ALLOC_FROM_POOL;

  37.     p->current = p;
  38.     p->chain = NULL;
  39.     p->large = NULL;
  40.     p->cleanup = NULL;
  41.     p->log = log;

  43.     ngx_core_probe_create_pool_done(p, size);

  45.     return p;
  46. }


  49. void
  50. ‌ngx_destroy_pool(ngx_pool_t *pool)
  51. {
  52.     ngx_pool_t          *p, *n;
  53.     ngx_pool_large_t    *l;
  54.     ngx_pool_cleanup_t  *c;

  56.     for (c = pool->cleanup; c; c = c->next) {
  57.         if (c->handler) {
  58.             ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_ALLOC, pool->log, 0,
  59.                            "run cleanup: %p", c);
  60.             c->handler(c->data);
  61.         }
  62.     }

  64. #if (NGX_DEBUG)

  66.     /*
  67.      * we could allocate the pool->log from this pool
  68.      * so we cannot use this log while free()ing the pool
  69.      */

  71.     for (l = pool->large; l; l = l->next) {
  72.         ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_ALLOC, pool->log, 0, "free: %p", l->alloc);
  73.     }

  75.     for (p = pool, n = pool->d.next; /* void */; p = n, n = n->d.next) {
  76.         ngx_log_debug2(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_ALLOC, pool->log, 0,
  77.                        "free: %p, unused: %uz", p, p->d.end - p->d.last);

  79.         if (n == NULL) {
  80.             break;
  81.         }
  82.     }

  84. #endif

  86.     for (l = pool->large; l; l = l->next) {
  87.         if (l->alloc) {
  88.             ngx_free(l->alloc);
  89.         }
  90.     }

  92.     for (p = pool, n = pool->d.next; /* void */; p = n, n = n->d.next) {
  93.         ngx_free(p);

  95.         if (n == NULL) {
  96.             break;
  97.         }
  98.     }
  99. }


  102. void
  103. ‌ngx_reset_pool(ngx_pool_t *pool)
  104. {
  105.     ngx_pool_t        *p;
  106.     ngx_pool_large_t  *l;

  108.     for (l = pool->large; l; l = l->next) {
  109.         if (l->alloc) {
  110.             ngx_free(l->alloc);
  111.         }
  112.     }

  114.     for (p = pool; p; p = p->d.next) {
  115.         p->d.last = (u_char *) p + sizeof(ngx_pool_t);
  116.         p->d.failed = 0;
  117.     }

  119.     pool->current = pool;
  120.     pool->chain = NULL;
  121.     pool->large = NULL;
  122. }


  125. void *
  126. ‌ngx_palloc(ngx_pool_t *pool, size_t size)
  127. {
  128. #if !(NGX_DEBUG_PALLOC)
  129.     if (size <= pool->max) {
  130.         return ngx_palloc_small(pool, size, 1);
  131.     }
  132. #endif

  134.     return ngx_palloc_large(pool, size);
  135. }


  138. void *
  139. ‌ngx_pnalloc(ngx_pool_t *pool, size_t size)
  140. {
  141. #if !(NGX_DEBUG_PALLOC)
  142.     if (size <= pool->max) {
  143.         return ngx_palloc_small(pool, size, 0);
  144.     }
  145. #endif

  147.     return ngx_palloc_large(pool, size);
  148. }


  151. static ngx_inline void *
  152. ‌ngx_palloc_small(ngx_pool_t *pool, size_t size, ngx_uint_t align)
  153. {
  154.     u_char      *m;
  155.     ngx_pool_t  *p;

  157.     p = pool->current;

  159.     do {
  160.         m = p->d.last;

  162.         if (align) {
  163.             m = ngx_align_ptr(m, NGX_ALIGNMENT);
  164.         }

  166.         if ((size_t) (p->d.end - m) >= size) {
  167.             p->d.last = m + size;

  169.             return m;
  170.         }

  172.         p = p->d.next;

  174.     } while (p);

  176.     return ngx_palloc_block(pool, size);
  177. }


  180. static void *
  181. ‌ngx_palloc_block(ngx_pool_t *pool, size_t size)
  182. {
  183.     u_char      *m;
  184.     size_t       psize;
  185.     ngx_pool_t  *p, *new;

  187.     psize = (size_t) (pool->d.end - (u_char *) pool);

  189.     m = ngx_memalign(NGX_POOL_ALIGNMENT, psize, pool->log);
  190.     if (m == NULL) {
  191.         return NULL;
  192.     }

  194.     new = (ngx_pool_t *) m;

  196.     new->d.end = m + psize;
  197.     new->d.next = NULL;
  198.     new->d.failed = 0;

  200.     m += sizeof(ngx_pool_data_t);
  201.     m = ngx_align_ptr(m, NGX_ALIGNMENT);
  202.     new->d.last = m + size;

  204.     for (p = pool->current; p->d.next; p = p->d.next) {
  205.         if (p->d.failed++ > 4) {
  206.             pool->current = p->d.next;
  207.         }
  208.     }

  210.     p->d.next = new;

  212.     return m;
  213. }


  216. static void *
  217. ‌ngx_palloc_large(ngx_pool_t *pool, size_t size)
  218. {
  219.     void              *p;
  220.     ngx_uint_t         n;
  221.     ngx_pool_large_t  *large;

  223.     p = ngx_alloc(size, pool->log);
  224.     if (p == NULL) {
  225.         return NULL;
  226.     }

  228.     n = 0;

  230.     for (large = pool->large; large; large = large->next) {
  231.         if (large->alloc == NULL) {
  232.             large->alloc = p;
  233.             return p;
  234.         }

  236.         if (n++ > 3) {
  237.             break;
  238.         }
  239.     }

  241.     large = ngx_palloc_small(pool, sizeof(ngx_pool_large_t), 1);
  242.     if (large == NULL) {
  243.         ngx_free(p);
  244.         return NULL;
  245.     }

  247.     large->alloc = p;
  248.     large->next = pool->large;
  249.     pool->large = large;

  251.     return p;
  252. }


  255. void *
  256. ‌ngx_pmemalign(ngx_pool_t *pool, size_t size, size_t alignment)
  257. {
  258.     void              *p;
  259.     ngx_pool_large_t  *large;

  261.     p = ngx_memalign(alignment, size, pool->log);
  262.     if (p == NULL) {
  263.         return NULL;
  264.     }

  266.     large = ngx_palloc_small(pool, sizeof(ngx_pool_large_t), 1);
  267.     if (large == NULL) {
  268.         ngx_free(p);
  269.         return NULL;
  270.     }

  272.     large->alloc = p;
  273.     large->next = pool->large;
  274.     pool->large = large;

  276.     return p;
  277. }


  280. ngx_int_t
  281. ‌ngx_pfree(ngx_pool_t *pool, void *p)
  282. {
  283.     ngx_pool_large_t  *l;

  285.     for (l = pool->large; l; l = l->next) {
  286.         if (p == l->alloc) {
  287.             ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_ALLOC, pool->log, 0,
  288.                            "free: %p", l->alloc);
  289.             ngx_free(l->alloc);
  290.             l->alloc = NULL;

  292.             return NGX_OK;
  293.         }
  294.     }

  296.     return NGX_DECLINED;
  297. }


  300. void *
  301. ‌ngx_pcalloc(ngx_pool_t *pool, size_t size)
  302. {
  303.     void *p;

  305.     p = ngx_palloc(pool, size);
  306.     if (p) {
  307.         ngx_memzero(p, size);
  308.     }

  310.     return p;
  311. }


  314. ngx_pool_cleanup_t *
  315. ‌ngx_pool_cleanup_add(ngx_pool_t *p, size_t size)
  316. {
  317.     ngx_pool_cleanup_t  *c;

  319.     c = ngx_palloc(p, sizeof(ngx_pool_cleanup_t));
  320.     if (c == NULL) {
  321.         return NULL;
  322.     }

  324.     if (size) {
  325.         c->data = ngx_palloc(p, size);
  326.         if (c->data == NULL) {
  327.             return NULL;
  328.         }

  330.     } else {
  331.         c->data = NULL;
  332.     }

  334.     c->handler = NULL;
  335.     c->next = p->cleanup;

  337.     p->cleanup = c;

  339.     ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_ALLOC, p->log, 0, "add cleanup: %p", c);

  341.     return c;
  342. }


  345. void
  346. ‌ngx_pool_run_cleanup_file(ngx_pool_t *p, ngx_fd_t fd)
  347. {
  348.     ngx_pool_cleanup_t       *c;
  349.     ngx_pool_cleanup_file_t  *cf;

  351.     for (c = p->cleanup; c; c = c->next) {
  352.         if (c->handler == ngx_pool_cleanup_file) {

  354.             cf = c->data;

  356.             if (cf->fd == fd) {
  357.                 c->handler(cf);
  358.                 c->handler = NULL;
  359.                 return;
  360.             }
  361.         }
  362.     }
  363. }


  366. void
  367. ‌ngx_pool_cleanup_file(void *data)
  368. {
  369.     ngx_pool_cleanup_file_t  *c = data;

  371.     ngx_log_debug1(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_ALLOC, c->log, 0, "file cleanup: fd:%d",
  372.                    c->fd);

  374.     if (ngx_close_file(c->fd) == NGX_FILE_ERROR) {
  375.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, c->log, ngx_errno,
  376.                       ngx_close_file_n " \"%s\" failed", c->name);
  377.     }
  378. }


  381. void
  382. ‌ngx_pool_delete_file(void *data)
  383. {
  384.     ngx_pool_cleanup_file_t  *c = data;

  386.     ngx_err_t  err;

  388.     ngx_log_debug2(NGX_LOG_DEBUG_ALLOC, c->log, 0, "file cleanup: fd:%d %s",
  389.                    c->fd, c->name);

  391.     if (ngx_delete_file(c->name) == NGX_FILE_ERROR) {
  392.         err = ngx_errno;

  394.         if (err != NGX_ENOENT) {
  395.             ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_CRIT, c->log, err,
  396.                           ngx_delete_file_n " \"%s\" failed", c->name);
  397.         }
  398.     }

  400.     if (ngx_close_file(c->fd) == NGX_FILE_ERROR) {
  401.         ngx_log_error(NGX_LOG_ALERT, c->log, ngx_errno,
  402.                       ngx_close_file_n " \"%s\" failed", c->name);
  403.     }
  404. }


  407. #if 0

  409. static void *
  410. ngx_get_cached_block(size_t size)
  411. {
  412.     void                     *p;
  413.     ngx_cached_block_slot_t  *slot;

  415.     if (ngx_cycle->cache == NULL) {
  416.         return NULL;
  417.     }

  419.     slot = &ngx_cycle->cache[(size + ngx_pagesize - 1) / ngx_pagesize];

  421.     slot->tries++;

  423.     if (slot->number) {
  424.         p = slot->block;
  425.         slot->block = slot->block->next;
  426.         slot->number--;
  427.         return p;
  428.     }

  430.     return NULL;
  431. }

  433. #endif
